text:
If anyone winds up here, and falls in to the almost non-existent population who want to green, then I was able to implement this in a few hours. At least, I think I did - I couldn't find a clear description, but if you:

• filter to runners you bet on in a market
• for each one individually, place a bet to "share" the expected P/L across all runners
    ◦ so if that runner has profit, place a lay bet, and vice versa
Then the market is magically greened without needing to worry about linear programming. Which also does work, but at least for me, I could only make work by placing bets on the whole market.

I find this approach doesn't lead to the same quality of greening up as the BF site, probably because I just take the current best price, but it covers my needs (which is to redistribute massively unbalance P/L, so maybe I have a runner at +£50 and one at -£50, but across the market  market I have EV of £1)
